summary.name: Microsoft
summary.description: Microsoft is one of the biggest technology companies in the world, founded by Bill Gates. The company develops programs and software under the Microsoft brand to sell to consumers, and is most known for its Windows operating system. Not only does Microsoft operate at its Redmond, Washington headquarters, but Microsoft has expanded to a big-tech force with locations across the globe. Over its 40-year history, the company has grown to a massive size -- where subsidaries, data centers, hundreds of offices, and various suppliers have come under their operation.

overview.name: Microsoft Headquarters
overview.description: Microsoft Headquarters, also known as the Redmond Campus, is the main location of operations for Microsoft. Operations for almost all Microsoft products occur here, most notably their Windows operating system. Besides offices, the campus boasts 502 acres of recreation, shopping, eateries, and more.

overview.name: Bing (Search Engine)
overview.description: Bing is a web search engine owned and operated by Microsoft. Similar to Google, services such as images, videos, shopping, maps, and news are available through Bing. It is currently the third biggest web search engine, but behind by a large margin. It is managed at Microsoft's headquarters in Redmond, Washington.

overview.name: Microsoft Americas Operation Center
overview.description: Microsoft Americas Operation Center is one of three major Microsoft operations centers around the globe. Dealing with the Americas (North & South America), this location in Reno, Nevada is home to offices and continental operations regarding original equipment manufacturers (OEM), volume licensing, Microsoft Xbox, online advertising, dynamics, and more. Other commercial + logistic operations occur here, such as the localization of products.

overview.name: Microsoft Ireland Operations
overview.description: Microsoft Ireland Operations is one of three major Microsoft operations centers around the globe. This location services European, Middle Eastern, and African regions. Similar to MAOC, certain Microsoft products are localized at this center for the countries it services. Commercial operations occur here, like Device Partner Operations (DPS) and work by their World Wide Credit Services organization. It also acts as an office for Microsoft employees.

location.address: South County Business Park, One Microsoft Place, Carmanhall and Leopardstown, Dublin, D18 P521, Ireland

overview.name: Microsoft Singapore Operations
overview.description: Microsoft Singapore Operations is one of three major Microsoft operations centers around the globe. Microsoft Singapore services Japan, India, Greater China, and the Asian-Pacific. This location also localizes products, and works with commercial operations and logistics. Microsoft software, services, graphics, and solutions are all key aspects of this operations center, along with areas for office work.

overview.name: Microsoft Research Asia
overview.description: Microsoft's Asian Research & Development Center is apart of what the company considers a close relationship with China. It is their most "complete" subsidiary, along with their largest R&D center outside of the United States. Within these centers, over 200 research scientists come together to work towards launching new products and developing Microsoft as a brand. It is also home to many journals and work within academia. It is one of seven R&D labs under Microsoft.

location.address: Tower 2, Microsoft Building, No. 5 Danling Street, Haidian District, Beijing, China

overview.name: Technology Production
overview.description: Microsoft's Technology Production occurs in China. What was once located in Wilsonville, Oregon moved operations to China in 2017. The "Surface Hub" is the home of Microsoft manufacturing for devices such as the Surface, Windows computers, and more.

overview.name: Microsoft Xbox
overview.description: Microsoft's game console, Xbox, is headquartered at Microsoft's main campus in Redmond, Washington. It is created and owned by the company. Along with being a physical console, the Xbox brand has its own line of games, applications, an online multiplayer service, and a game studio by the name of Xbox Game Studios.

overview.name: Skype
overview.description: Skype is a service that provides video and audio chatting between devices such as computers, tablets, phones, and more. The company was aquired by Microsoft and is now integrated into the Microsoft brand. Certain Microsoft technologies, such as the Xbox and the Windows operating system recognize Skype as a primary communication program. Microsoft Outlook and Xbox Live also have directly connectability to Skype. The Skype headquarters in Luxembourg has video and audio studios, offices, and social areas.

overview.name: Microsoft Cheyanne Data Center
overview.description: Microsoft Cheyanne Data Center is one of many data center locations that power Microsoft Azure, a cloud service application similar to Amazon Web Services. This specific site has 200 megawatts of power that happens to be fueled by all wind turbines.

overview.name: Microsoft Boydton Data Center
overview.description: Microsoft Boydton Data Center is one of many data center locations that power Microsoft Azure, a cloud service application similar to Amazon Web Services. This specific site is over a million square feet, and has strong fiber connectivity. This is because of existing routes that support a government data center within the area.

overview.name: Microsoft Quincy Data Center
overview.description: Microsoft Quincy Data Center is one of many data center locations that power Microsoft Azure, a cloud service application similar to Amazon Web Services. Quincy, Washington is home to other data centers, though Microsoft was the first to pilot this location in 2006. It has expanded to over 800,000 square feet and features 100 megawatts of power.

overview.name: Intel Corporation ("Wintel")
overview.description: Intel Corporation is a strong partner of Microsoft. "Wintel" is the official partnership name between the two. Microsoft Windows and Intel have worked together in making personal computers, as Intel acts as the processor for devices running Windows. Intel's headquarters is located in Silicon Valley, a location that is undoubtably the home of technology.

location.address: 2200 Mission College Blvd, Santa Clara, CA 95052

overview.name: Mojang
overview.description: Mojang Studios, the video game studio known for Minecraft, is a subsidiary of Microsoft. The acquisition of the studio allowed Microsoft to expand Minecraft as a game. The company promised in 2014, when the transaction occurred, that they would dedicate investments into powering further development of the game and integrating Minecraft into the Microsoft community, such as expanding it to their roster of Xbox compatible games. Mojang is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

overview.name: LinkedIn
overview.description: LinkedIn, a Microsoft subsidiary, is an online platform known for professional networking. In 2016, Microsoft acquired LinkedIn. The transaction allowed for better cloud space under Azure, room for growth as a company, and connections to Microsoft's professional Office 365 programs. LinkedIn's headquarters is located in Sunnyvale, California.

overview.name: GitHub
overview.description: GitHub, a Microsoft subsidiary, provides internet hosting for coding. Microsoft's 2018 acquisition of the company allowed them to expand on their dive into open-source development. It also was an opportunity for Microsoft developers to share their knowledge through the platform. GitHub's headquarters is located in San Francisco, California.

location.address: 88 Colin P Kelly Jr Street, San Francisco, CA 94107

overview.name: Suppliers
overview.description: Microsoft suppliers provide parts for their devices. Microsoft bridges partnerships with these businesses in order for them to fulfill products such as microphones, metals, touch-pads, cooling technologies, power supplies, and more. These companies are located all over the world, with some being United States-based. Many are also located in Asian regions such as Japan, Taiwan, and China.
